@xushenkun I have now used non-softmax tensor to feed into ctc_loss function, but I still cannot achieve 0 loss with your example. I think this is a tensorflow bug, please double check my code here.

update:
After I swapped this line
target = tf.SparseTensor(indices=[[0, 0], [0, 2]], values=[1, 2], dense_shape=[1, 3])

with
target = tf.SparseTensor(indices=[[0, 0], [0, 1], [0, 2]], values=[1, 0, 2], dense_shape=[1, 3])

I get 0 loss!

body:
@xushenkun I have now used non-softmax tensor to feed into `ctc_loss` function, but I still cannot achieve 0 loss with your example. I think this is a tensorflow bug, please double check my code [here](https://gist.github.com/marcoleewow/037fc43733260300083aab0db2d7d9a8).

update:
After I swapped this line 
`target = tf.SparseTensor(indices=[[0, 0], [0, 2]], values=[1, 2], dense_shape=[1, 3])`

with
`target = tf.SparseTensor(indices=[[0, 0], [0, 1], [0, 2]], values=[1, 0, 2], dense_shape=[1, 3])`

I get 0 loss!
